Description: Handle-plate sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery column-krater; cream slip; on top, black -figure decoration consisting of bird or siren (lower body remaining with added red on tail feathers) to right; part of undetermined decoration at right; around edge of handle plate, wavy black vertical bars; underside black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The accession number on the sherd reads only H2779, 'h' has been added as there are seven other sherds with the same number.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.299)
